CatDescriptText: Mrs. Sadie Powers, housewife, 1850 Wylie Avenue, was part of the "Pittsburghers Speak Up" column published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, August 2, 1958, pg. 2 with question: "Do you think waitresses should be paid a minimum of $1 per hour plus tips?" answer reads: "Waitresses have to be very shrewd and be on the ball. I think they should earn $1 an hour plus their tips."
TitMainTitle: Portrait of Sadie Powers, wearing eyeglasses, earrings, two strand necklace, and light colored striped dress with sheer short sleeves, seated in wooden chair holding floral handbag, woman and door and trim with peeling paint in background
